reviews.text: Wild Wild Wet is a fantastic water park in Singapore, perfect for a fun-filled day with family and friends. With thrilling slides like the Vortex and Ular-Lah, as well as relaxing attractions like Shiok River, it offers something for everyone. The park is well-maintained, with clean facilities and friendly staff, ensuring a safe and enjoyable experience. Kids will love the Professorâ€™s Playground, while adrenaline seekers can brave the Free Fall slide. The only downside is the occasional crowds, but the excitement makes up for it. Overall, Wild Wild Wet is a must-visit for water adventure lovers!

Had great experience here with my family. The price is also affordable for the public. Each ticket is about $30 for each pax. There is a great variety of slides for both children and adults to play in. There are several family themed slides and some for more thrill seekers. It is within walking distance of the mrt station or just 1 bus stop away.

Singapore's Wild Wild Wet theme park offers an exhilarating weekend getaway filled with thrilling adventures for all ages. The park is packed with a variety of high-speed water rides, including heart-pounding slides, twisting rapids, and wave pools that provide excitement for adrenaline junkies. Attractions like the "Royal Flush" take guests on a dizzying plunge, while the "Racers" swirls riders down a massive funnel, leaving them gasping for air. For those looking for a more laid-back experience, the lazy river and wave pool provide a relaxing escape. Families can also enjoy interactive water play areas, perfect for young children. The vibrant atmosphere, combined with the refreshing water, ensures that everyone, from kids to adults, has a fantastic time. With fun, thrills, and laughter all around, Wild Wild Wet promises a memorable experience and a great way to cool off while enjoying exciting moments together.

Liked this place as it is not that crowded on weekdays. With annual membership, easy to stop by after school.
It stops all facility when bad weather is coming due to the risk of lightning. There is no compensation for this. You can wait till weather becomes better to enjoy the park or leave in this case.

Was in early Dec 24, not crowded. Some attractions were closed. All in all is good, lazy river is bigger than Adventure Cove but quality wise adventure cove is better (also a lot more expensive) . Locker price is a bit on the high side too.
